data.text: Then Job said to his three friends,
“You ◄talk as though/You think► [SAR] that you are the people whom everyone should listen to,
But I have as much good sense as you do;
My friends all laugh at me now.
Those like you who have no troubles make fun of me;
Bandits live peacefully,
“But ask the wild animals what they know about God,
If you could ask the creatures that crawl on the ground, or the fish in the sea,
All of them certainly know [RHQ] that it is Yahweh who has made them with his hands.
He directs the lives of all living creatures;
And when we [SYN] hear what other people like you say,
Old people are often very wise,
but God is wise and very powerful;
If he tears something down, no one can rebuild it;
When he prevents rain from falling, everything dries up.
He is the one who is truly strong and wise;
He sometimes causes the king’s officials to no longer be wise,
He takes from kings the robes that they wear
He takes from priests the sacred clothes that they wear, with the result that they no longer can do their work,
He sometimes causes those whom others trust to be unable to speak,
He causes those who have authority to be despised,
He causes things that are hidden in the darkness to be revealed.
He causes some nations to become very great,
He causes some rulers to become foolish/stupid,
They grope around in the darkness, without any light,
